subject: Reporting historical test results
msgSnippet: First disclaimer: I am new to the group, and am sorry if this was already covered previously. Second disclaimer: I did try to wade through the archives, but
messageBody:
First disclaimer: I am new to the group, and am sorry if this was
already covered previously.

Second disclaimer: I did try to wade through the archives, but could
not find what I was looking for. There was one thread that seemed
to be in the right vein, but didn't actually have an answer.

=============

Finally - my question:

Is there an automated way to output the summary data (#tests,
#errors, #failures) from my JUnit Report to an external file
(possibly xls, or a file accessible by spreadsheet) in order to
maintain a history of our results?

In the ideal world, there would never be any errors or failures, but
the point of the testing is to make us confident in making code
changes. We run a nightlybuild regression, so the next morning I
can see if I missed anything (sometimes the failures are well
removed from the actual class that was changed).

So, we would like to be able to record historical data of the
fluctuations. In the past, manually, we have found that the
errors/failures go up when we get above a certain velocity.

Thanks for any insight that can be provided.

Dianne Doss
